title: Is it possible to activate on FF74.0 on Win10 the navigation through left/right swipe on touchpad, like on Edge or FF on macOS?
content:
I have been using FF on macOS as my browser of choice at work for a while, from MountainLion on, and I really enjoy the possibility to navigate back and forth on my tabs history just using the touchpad. Recently, I bought a new pc with Win10 and rely on FF for my personal browsing too. Unfortunately, I found that the same feature I found on macOS is not working on PC (but it is available on Edge). I tried some suggestions found online involving modifying a couple of values on config page (browser.gesture.swipe.left/right), but sorted no effect (tbh the values were probably already set properly).

In the end, is there any chance to activate this feature on FF on Win10, preferably without addons? Or is it a problem related to OS/hardware?

Thank you and have a nice day ^^
creator: enrico.pontello

title: Looking for socks5 proxy support over TLS.1. 3 on firefox.Could you please help why firefox doesn't send any client hello to socks proxy via tls handshake?
content:
1)setup Socks5 proxy support as needed from firefox help page 2)Enable TLS settings to max value to 4 (to enable tls.1.3) 3)Connect to socks5 proxy via web browsing

observation: 1) plain socks5 messages are sent to server Expected 1)Needed to send client hello on socks5 proxy for TLS handshake.

title: Colorize/shade most recently accessed tabs for easier navigation of tabs when having a lot's of tabs open.
content: I'm constantly using firefox with loads of tabs open. I would like to have them on multiple rows, so please an option for that. There's some addons to achieve this I think (suggestions?), but it could just be a basic option in firefox. Secondly I would love a feature, that would colorize/shade/fade tabs that I have most recently accessed, so I would have a clear and easy view where are those tabs I had open a moment ago. Another feature I'm thinking would be the possibility to colorize tabs for certaing web-pages / domain. Like, every youtube-tab would be red etc. Yeah there is the icon, but it's small and for some pages the icons are quite similar and hard to distinct. Especially when sitting a bit further from the screen. So any suggestions on addons to achieve these features?

title: firefox on sci-linux 7.4 fails with GLib-GObject-CRITICAL segmentation fault
content:
i've been running firefox on my scientific linux 7.4 machine for years and suddenly it doesnt work anymore. i'm getting the error:

(firefox:10092): GLib-GObject-CRITICAL **: 14:37:57.501: g_object_ref: assertion 'object->ref_count > 0' failed segmentation fault (core dumped)

I'm using firefox 68.6.0:1.el7_7 with glibc 0:2.17-292.el7 and my kernel is 3.10.0-514.21.2.el7.x86_64. I've tried upgrading, downgrading, removing, reinstalling, erasing (with all mozilla files) and installing and the error is the same every time except the PID code. i've tried different versions of glibc and i've tried renaming /.mozilla to force it to make a new profile. the error always comes up the same.

this is all so weird because i've been using firefox on this machine for 4 years and never had an issue, but now it seems like nothing i try will fix it! Thanks in advance for the help

creator: sailor842

title: Terrible upstream network performance using Firefox on Windows 10 1909
content: There is a measuring tool for evaluating ISP performance http://bredbandskollen.se When I test my Windows 10 1909 using firefox I get 484,41 Mbit/s downstream and 5,69 Mbit/s upstream When I do the same with Microsoft EDGE, I get 483,78 Mbit/s downstream and 617,09 Mbit/s So, the downstream performance is the same, but for the upstream performance, the difference is more than 100 times! (This behaviour using Firefox on Windows is nothing I have seen before).
creator: irixpower

title: I have more than 4000 bookmarks in folders, subfolders and sub-subfolders. The bookmark-saving-window is toooo small.
content:
Hello everybody. I have saved several thousand bookmarks, and often they are added. I have 20 folders in the bookmark sidebar. In each of these main-folders there are 4 - 25 subfolders and in there sub-subfolders etc. To save new bookmarks I type Ctrl + D, to open the bookmark-saving-window. Than I have to scroll, scroll, open folder, scroll, scroll, open sub-folder, scroll, etc.

Imagine, your Windows file manager would only be so small, you would go crazy. It would be better, to be able to enlarge the bookmark-saving-window. Or even bring it to screen size with one click. This would be a great relief for everyone who frequently saves bookmarks. And nothing would change for the others.

Another point: I often save several new bookmarks in one folder. In the bookmark memory, the folder that was used previously, is never displayed. So you have to click again, to show the last used folder. It would make more sense, always to display the last used folder. Then you could save the bookmark with 'Enter' and only have to click on if you want a different folder.

I'm definitely not the only one who saves many bookmarks. But here in the forum I have not found a post that deals with this problem.

Thank you very much and best regards, wkijsa.
creator: semiorol
